adr_address: Corso Concordia, 1, 20129 Milano MI, Italy

editorial_summary.overview: Art nouveau hotel offering art-inspired quarters, plus an elegant restaurant, a bar & a spa.

name: Château Monfort

plus_code.compound_code: F694+8V Milan, Metropolitan City of Milan, Italy

reviews.text:
Nice 5-star hotel with a unique and somewhat whimsical, fairytale-like style. I stayed here for the second time recently, and while the decor can be a bit over the top, the overall experience is solid. The location isn’t right in the center, but it’s still fairly central and well-connected, making it convenient enough for exploring Milan without being in the middle of the crowds.

Service is consistently good, and the staff are professional and helpful. The hotel has a spa, which is decent—not extraordinary, but a nice extra. I didn’t try the restaurant or breakfast, so I can’t comment on that part.

One downside is the room layout, which can be a bit awkward, and the rooms themselves are on the smaller side—even the upgraded room we stayed in felt quite compact. Still, it’s quiet, clean, and offers a level of comfort and service that makes it a good option if you’re looking for a more affordable five-star stay in Milan. I’d recommend it for travelers who want a touch of luxury without the price tag of the city’s top-tier hotels.

We had a wonderful stay at Hotel Montfort. Roberta’s warm service was a highlight, and the staff overall were exceptional — from the bellmen who were always quick with bags, taxis, and any request, to the fast in-room service (a steamer was even provided on request). On our first night, the team kindly upgraded us to a larger room, though it was a bit more dated; when we returned a few days later, our room was beautifully updated and exactly what we had hoped for. Turn-down service was also excellent.

This hotel was incredibly fancy and high-end — perfect for anyone who enjoys a luxury experience. The rooms were small but beautifully designed and very comfortable, with a bathroom that was elegant and high-end. The staff were exceptional — warm, professional, and genuinely kind. A special mention goes to Siad, our favourite staff member, who made our mornings at breakfast extra special. The receptionist was also fantastic and very welcoming. The location was ideal, close to great shops and restaurants. Highly recommend for a stylish and memorable stay.

We had a fantastic 3 day stay here. Greeted by friendly concierge staff, very well turned out and welcoming, (first impressions always count for me) they took our luggage into reception and the keys for our car to be parked up for duration of our stay.

Friendly welcome from young lady on reception, (again both ladies very smartly dressed)  who checked us in, explained the layout of hotel, and the restaurant and lounge bar opening times, then showed us to our room, our luggage was delivered to our room before we arrived,  our room was amazing facing onto the metro station, with a small balcony to stand on, bed had a screen round it so was luvly and cool, and very comfy, a bath with a overhead shower also a hand spray, plenty storage space in wardrobe, which also had drawers, a table and  chairs  fridge and coffee / tea facilities, slippers and dressing gowns, a luvly room, turndown service in the evening, cleaned daily to a very high standard, again housekeeping staff friendly and smartly dressed.

Breakfast again, a friendly  welcome from smartly dressed young ladies, shown daily to a table of our choice. Offered and served our tea and coffee by a very nice, well-dressed, tall young man who was luvly and chatted to us daily.  All the usual fruit, yogurts, croissants, cold meat, and cheeses, etc.on offer, we enjoyed the tasty scrambled eggs daily, and also an array of beautiful cakes 😆

We treated ourselves to a nightcap on our first evening after dining out, plenty of restaurant's nearby to choose from, a luvly barman who knew his stuff, made us delightful cocktails, a bit expensive but it was a one off,

Check out was easy, again reception staff smartly dressed,  both ladies had matching outfits on,  asked for our car to be delivered for 9am , but informed our car ready after our breakfast. again friendly concierge staff took our luggage to our hire car.

This hotel is in an excellent location,  we walked to the cathedral, (worth a visit) and walked back through the highend fashion stores area, took the metro to the Da Vinci Museo, then another short metro trip to the canal, then a tram back to hotel.

Our stay was exceptional, from the moment we arrived, till we checked out, we njoyed the luxury that the hotel had to offer, I would Highly Recommend a stay here for a truly 5☆ experience.
PS. I hope reception and other staff njoyed the 2 boxes of Scottish Biscuits we left 😀

Grazie a tutto lo staff meraviglioso che ha reso il nostro soggiorno cosi speciale e memorabile.  : )  :)  :)

(Thank you to all the wonderful staff who made our stay so special and memorable)

I had an amazing stay at this beautiful hotel. From the moment I arrived, the service was top notch. Everyone on staff was super friendly and made me feel really welcome. After a long day of exploring, it honestly felt like stepping into a little slice of paradise.

The location couldn’t be better. The metro is right outside the hotel, which made getting around the city super easy. The room was cozy and comfortable, and the breakfast was seriously next level. Everything was fresh, tasty, and there was plenty of variety.

Overall, just a fantastic experience. I’d definitely recommend this place and would love to come back. Five stars all the way!
